title: Business Live: US markets turn positive - BBC News
summary: call for energy bill price cap .

documents.title: good night
text: thank you for joining business live today .
we 'll be back early tomorrow morning when we 'll learn if investors approve or disapprove of what bt and sky are paying to broadcast premier league football matches .
see you then .

documents.title: tim cook is 'not a fan ' of special dividends
text: anyone hoping for a nice big windfall if apple decides to repatriate some of its $ 285bn overseas cash pile might be disappointed .
there has been much speculation that apple could bring some of that money back to the us following the country 's recent tax changes .
however , at apple 's annual shareholder meeting on tuesday , mr cook said : `` special dividends , i 'm not really a fan of .
`` but in terms of annual increases in the dividend , it is something that this board and management are committed to doing . ''

documents.title: us markets close up
text: the us markets ended tuesday in positive territory after trading began in the red .
the dow jones industrial average closed up 0.16 % at 24,640 points .
the s & p 500 was up 0.26 % at 2,663 points , and the nasdaq was up 0.45 % at 7014 points .

documents.title: that marmite question
text: the marmite question .
do advertisers love or hate facebook and google ?
i 've never once purchased something because it 's on facebook or google .
if anything , i purposely avoid it on principle .
i have advert blockers .

strange how the tablet manufacturers do n't want people to install advert blocking - you need to root a device to install decent blockers , but most devices are not rootable ( especially not that pos ipad / iphone ) .
simon my family where bought up on marmite i actually knit one too from a knitting pattern can you message me would love to know your jack family history ?
i 'm a jack too
the only thing i would like to see advertised is a device that blocks data miners , marketing analytics , and other programs that sell on your information .
so `` advertiser 's can better improve your online experience '' .
ad blockers are the best .

documents.title: virgin atlantic in palestinian couscous row
text: virgin atlantic has found itself at the centre of a social media row after removing the word palestinian from an in-flight meal following complaints .
a couscous-style salad had been described on a menu as `` inspired by the flavours of palestine '' .
pro-israel social media users called for a boycott of the airline , saying it pandered to palestinian supporters .
however , the airline 's decision to remove the terms sparked a fresh backlash from palestinian sympathisers .
read more here .

documents.title: macron full of praise for ecb president
text: emmanuel macron does n't care what nationality the next president of the european central bank is - as long as they are as competent as the current chief mario draghi (
mr draghi , an italian , is n't going anywhere just yet - his term runs until october 2019 .
but it 's nice to know he has the confidence of the french president .

documents.title: love in the digital age
text: finding your valentine online might not be romantic , but is it more effective ?
i think dating sites remove a lot of the fun of getting to know somebody who 's very different .
my mrs did n't ( often still does n't ! )
like a lot of the stuff i like and vice versa but that 's 'sort of ' part of the charm of a relationship , introducing each other to things .

documents.title: bt sport to pay more per match
text: bt sport is paying £ 9.2m per football game under its new broadcasting deal with the premier league .
this compares to £ 7.6m per match in its existing agreement .

the company said : `` bt has remained financially disciplined during this process and remains in a strong position to make a return on this investment through subscription , wholesale , commercial and advertising revenues , especially following the acquisition of ee , which more than doubled bt 's customer base . ''

documents.title: wall street reverses earlier falls
text: us stock markets have reversed earlier falls and are now trading ahead .
dow jones industrial average is up 81.70 points at 24,682.97 .
the s & p 500 is up 9.07 points at 2,665.07 while the nasdaq is 32.91 points ahead at 7,014.87 .

documents.title: how the premier league deal breaks down
text: more on the premier league auction .
bt sport will pay a total £ 885m to broadcast 32 football matches per season on saturday with kick-off at 12.30pm between 2019/20 and 2021/22 .
under its previous agreement with the premier league , bt paid a total £ 960m over three years to show 42 games per season .
sky sports is paying a total £ 3.5bn to screen 128 matches per season under its new deal .
its rights include 32 games on saturday beginning at 5.30pm .
last time , sky paid a total £ 4.1bn to show 126 matches per season .

documents.title: 'status quo ' reaches ceiling in games auction
text: paolo pescatore , vice president in multiplay and media at ccs insight , says : `` as we predicted , there was only one likely scenario , the status quo . ''
bt and sky have agreed to pay £ 4.4bn to screen 160 premier league games per season over three seasons .
there are a total 200 matches for broadcast with two packages of 20 games each still being bid on .
in the last auction , bt and sky paid £ 5.1bn to show 168 games .
mr pescatore says : `` despite more games being available , the premier league has failed to maximise its prized asset .
this suggests that there is clearly a ceiling that consumers are willing to pay for watching premier league games and subsequently what providers ' are willing to bid for . ''

documents.title: premier league raises £ 4.4bn from broadcasting rights
text: the premier league says it has so far raised £ 4.4bn from auctioning off five of the seven broadcasting rights packages to bt sports and sky sport .
it says that there are two live packages still to be sold `` with interest from multiple bidders '' .

premier league executive chairman richard scudamore , says : `` to have achieved this investment with two packages of live rights remaining to sell is an outcome that is testament to the excellent football competition delivered by the clubs . ''

documents.title: breakingbt and sky win premier league uk live broadcasting rights
text: the premier league has announced that bt and sky have won five of the seven live broadcasting rights packages up for auction for seasons 2019/20 - 2021/22 .
more details to follow

documents.title: us weighs up tariffs on imports
text: donald trump says he is considering a range of options to address steel and aluminum imports that he said are hurting us producers .
the us president said : `` what we 're talking about it tariffs and/or quotas .
`` part of the options would be tariffs coming in .
as they dump steel , they pay tariffs , substantial tariffs , which means the united states would actually make a lot of money . ''

documents.title: all about inflation
text: economists are expecting us inflation to show a rise of 0.3 % in january when new data is announced on wednesday .
in december , the rise was a modest 0.1 % and for the 12 months it reached at 2.1 % .

mike terwilliger , portfolio manager at the resource credit income fund , says : `` after years of pronouncing inflation 'dead , ' the market is now suddenly focused on and dreading inflation , which of course was at the cornerstone of this most recent period of market volatility . ''

documents.title: watch : the robot that can open doors
text: is this a delightful toy ?
or a terrifying glimpse into a bleak future where robots dominate mankind ?
you decide .

documents.title: ireland may take 7 % hit in 'no-deal ' brexit
text: ireland may take 7 % hit in 'no-deal ' brexit
author: John Campbell
BBC News NI Economics & Business Editor

documents.title: the problem with confidentiality agreements
text: more news on the presidents club scandal .

the financial times , which broke the story in january , reports that the agency which originally hired women to work at the charity dinner in london has told them they can disregard a confidentiality agreement they signed if they want to report criminal behaviour to the police .
it is a distinct change of tack from the message these women were given before the event at the dorchester hotel .

documents.title: oil falls on supply/demand imbalance
text: oil prices fell after the paris-based international energy agency ( iea ) said that supply could outstrip demand in 2018 .
brent crude is down 0.5 % at $ 62.30 a barrel while west texas intermediate is off 0.9 % at $ 58.77 .
the iea lifted its forecast for oil demand growth to 1.4 million barrels per day from previous expectations of 1.3 million .
however , it said that growing output , particularly in the us , could outweigh demand .

it said : `` today , having cut costs dramatically , us producers are enjoying a second wave of growth so extraordinary that in 2018 their increase in liquids production could equal global demand growth . ''

documents.title: london markets close lower
text: the ftse 100 has ended tuesday down 9.05 points at 7,168.01 .
the ftse 250 is also lower at close , off 59.25 points at 19,320.08 .

documents.title: ten gigabit home broadband tested in uk
text: broadband speeds of up to 10 gigabits per second ( gbps ) have been tested in a home in the former olympic village in east london .
broadband operator hyperoptic conducted the test , claiming it is the first time such speeds have been brought to a uk home using an existing isp network rather than a dedicated line .
firms are now looking to roll out full-fibre technology in the uk .
ofcom boss sharon white said higher speeds were becoming more necessary .
read more here .

documents.title: us reciprocal tax risks a 'dangerous spiral '
text: the federation of german industries has warned that the us risks causing a `` dangerous spiral '' if it goes ahead with donald trump 's plan to implement a `` reciprocal tax '' on imports from countries that levy tariffs on us products .
its president dieter kempf told reuters : `` if the usa raises customs barriers , it could lead to a dangerous spiral .
instead of thinking about penalties and new trade barriers , we should further extend transatlantic trade and investment relations . ''

documents.title: us markets trim falls
text: the dow jones industrial average has trimmed its early trading fall but it remains in negative territory , down 76.74 points at 24,524.53 .
the nasdaq is now down just 4.35 points at 6,977.61 while the s & p 500 is off 6.04 points at 2,649.96 .

documents.title: xerox-fujifilm deal row escalates
text: xerox 's share price has taken a knock as the row over a decision to merge with japan 's fujifilm heated up .
darwin deason , a major shareholder in xerox is suing the print technology group to stop the complex merger with fujifilm .

meanwhile , xerox has hit back at an open letter from mr deason and activist investor carl icahn - also a shareholder in the company - saying that the deal with fujifilm is the best path for the business after it examined other alternatives .
xerox is down 1.7 % at $ 29.44 .

documents.title: watch : 'all talk ' from trump on trade
text: aaron klein , policy director of the centre on regulation and markets at the brookings institution has some advice for us president donald trump
as president trump discusses import tariffs on steel with members of congress @ twitterid of @ twitterid tells @ twitterid he 'd be better off concentrating on his # infrastructureplan

documents.title: pound up on dollar and euro
text: the pound is holding up against the dollar on tuesday afternoon .
sterling is now up 0.4 % on the greenback at $ 1.38930 and is also 0.4 % ahead on the euro at €1.12410 .

documents.title: us fed 'gradually normalising rates '
text: more from jerome powell who is taking part in a ceremonial swearing-in as the chairman of the federal reserve .
he graciously thanks his predecessors janet yellen and ben bernanke , adding : `` while the challenges we face are always evolving , the fed 's approach will remain the same .
`` today , the global economy is recovering strongly for the first time in a decade .
we are in the process of gradually normalising both interest rate policy and our balance sheet with a view to extending the recovery and sustaining the pursuit of our objectives . ''
chairman powell takes the oath of office at his ceremonial swearing-in :
meanwhile , this is janet yellen
a new swamp monster .
count the gold bars !
hope some of it is still there
there you are without a / after kneel ca $ h carry like me @ twitterid

documents.title: fed will keep 'essential ' financial regulation gains
text: the new chairman of the federal reserve says that he will preserve `` essential '' improvements in regulation put in place since the financial crisis .
jerome powell said the central bank would `` preserve the essential gains in financial regulation while seeking to ensure that our policies are as efficient as possible .
we will remain alert to any developing risks to financial stability '' .

documents.title: not in the clear yet
text: that did n't last long .
after a brief period of stock market gains , the dow jones , the s & p 500 and the nasdaq are all trading lower on tuesday .
`` we saw an impressive rebound yesterday , but by no means are we in the clear , '' says andre bakhos , managing director at new vines capital .
the next couple of days will be key for the markets , particularly on wednesday when new inflation figures will be released .
if inflation is stronger than expected , it could mean a faster rise in interest rates .
mr bakhos adds : `` i expect a continued stream of volatility , driven by uncertainty among investors with fears of accelerating rates .
i do n't think that 's going away any time soon . ''

documents.title: shares jump for revitalised under armour
text: 2017 was a bit of an annus horribilis for us sportswear maker under armour - its share price plunged after it was forced to cut its annual outlook more than once in an increasingly competitive market .
this year , however , is much more positive .
sales for the fourth quarter and the full-year have stabilised , sending its share price up 17.99 % on tuesday .

under armour chairman and chief executive kevin plank said : `` after years of rapid growth and building a globally recognised brand , the dynamic landscape of 2017 was a catalyst for us to begin strategically transforming under armour into an operationally excellent company .

`` a year into this journey , our fourth quarter and full year results demonstrate that the tough decisions we 're making are generating the stability necessary to create a more consistent and predictable path to deliver long-term value to our shareholders . ''

documents.title: breakingus markets open lower
text: the dow jones industrial average has fallen 145.45 points to 24,455.82 within seconds of opening trade on tuesday .
the s & p 500 is also down , off 10.97 points at 2,645.03 and the nasdaq is down 27.35 points at 6,955.35 .

documents.title: thomson reuters boss hospitalised
text: jim smith , the boss of thomson reuters , the news and data giant , has been hospitalised and chief financial officer stephane bello will take charge in his absence .
thomson reuters said mr smith was taken to a toronto hospital on monday `` after feeling unwell '' and remains under observation at the hospital .
mr smith recently agreed to sell a majority stake in thomson reuters 's financial and risk business to private equity firm blackstone group , valuing the unit at $ 20bn .

documents.title: born to be patient ?
text: bikers are n't exactly getting their motors running at the moment - which is why the boss of harley-davidson is asking its shareholders for some patience .
they 'll need it .
in its most recent results , harley-davidson 's fourth quarter sales were marginally ahead but full year revenue was down .
the largest drop , however , was in net income while worldwide sales of bikes fell 6.7 % in 2017 compared to the previous 12 months , with the biggest fall in the us .
harley davidson chief executive matt levatich tells reuters that he wants the motorcycle-maker to be a `` customer-creator '' by growing areas such as its learn-to-ride academies at showroom .
`` mindset shifts are not something that happen overnight , '' he says : `` but that 's very much core to the 10-year strategy for the company . ''

documents.title: watchdog 'must learn lessons from tragic grg saga '
text: the federation of small businesses says that the financial conduct authority must `` learn lessons from the tragic grg saga '' .
the treasury select committee has ordered the regulator to publish its report into rbs 's global restructuring group ( grg ) and its treatment of small businesses .
the federation of small businesses says : victims have been left waiting far too long to see its findings .
hundreds of small business owners who had their lives destroyed by grg are still waiting on compensation .
this report could help secure the redress they 're due .
in any case , the truth is the very least they deserve .
the fca should learn lessons from this tragic saga .
the treasury committee is right to say it lost control '' of this investigation . ''

documents.title: welsh fishing fleet demands brexit help
text: fishermen in wales fear losing their businesses unless they get help with brexit .
the welsh fishermen 's association told bbc wales that ministers needed to be planning a potential system of subsidies if fish exports were hit by tariffs and delays after brexit .
it claimed fishing businesses would `` go to the wall '' otherwise , with big implications for welsh coastal communities .
read the full article

documents.title: a million companies start workplace pensions
text: more than a million employers have now enrolled their staff into a workplace pension , the pensions regulator has reported .
it said the scheme has led to around 9.3 million people so far saving into a pension .

former pensions minister steve webb , now director of policy at insurer royal london , said it was `` a huge milestone '' but that the government needs to `` get savings levels up to more realistic levels as quickly as possible . ''

contribution levels to auto-enrolled company pensions start increasing in april and mr webb warned : `` we urgently need a plan to get people beyond the 8 % minimum contribution planned under existing legislation . ''

documents.title: china 's hna sells off $ 2bn of land
text: china 's cash-strapped hna has agreed to sell off two land parcels in hong kong worth 15.96bn hong kong dollars ( $ 2.04bn ; £ 1.47bn ) to developer henderson land .
the airline-to-finance behemoth has been looking to sell off assets , or raise financing against them , in an attempt to replenish its coffers .
last week , the conglomerate cut its stake in deutsche bank , and in january it sold off an australian office block to the us blackstone group for $ 166m .
the sale of the two land parcels , located at hong kong 's former kai tak airport site , is expected to go through on 14 february .
hna bought the land in 2016 .

documents.title: pepsico loses fizz
text: higher sakes in pepsico 's snacks business made up for the fizz going out of soft drink sales in the last three months of 2017 .
the gatorade , tro juices and mountain dew maker said sales at its frito-lay division rose 5 % , but the north american beverages business fell 3 % as consumers continue to shun sugary drinks .
revenue rose slightly to a better than expected $ 19.5bn , but the company posted a net loss of $ 710m following a $ 2.5bn one-off tax charge .
pepsico posted a $ 1.4bn profit for the same quarter in 2016 .

documents.title: billionaire bets
text: business editor simon jack tweets about ray dalio 's hedge fund :
in total 13 billion of shorts in dalio 's bridgewater fund .
taking some big big bets .
bnp bet looks brave to me .
i would have though it 's a beneficiary of rising interest spreads and growing eurozone economy .
but hey , i 'm not billionaire ray dalio .
why not ?
he is not a long only fund .
makes sense to leverage some shorts which seem quite inflation centered as well ( energy , banks ) .
i 'm actually surprised it 's not bigger .

documents.title: market update
text: sterling is just above $ 1.39 , up about 0.5 % today , after the inflation figures earlier stoked expectations of an interest rate rise as soon as may .
the ftse 100 , meanwhile , is still in positive territory , but only just - up less than 10 points at 7,186 .
severn trent is the biggest faller on the ftse 100 , down 2.7 % , while wpp is the biggest riser , up 2.8 % .

documents.title: morgan vs fca
text: economics correspondent andy verity tweets an update on the row between the treasury select committee and the financial conduct authority over a report into rbs ' global restructuring group :
the @ twitterid has ordered the @ twitterid using parliamentary powers to publish the skilled person 's s.166 report on the scandal-hit global restructuring group :
@ twitterid risks being in contempt of parliament

documents.title: a second referendum ?
text: jim edwards at business insider has up on a controversial prediction by samuel tombs at pantheon macroeconomics :

it is becoming increasingly clear that none of the forms of brexit that the eu is willing to tolerate can command enough support from her own party 's mps , or would please enough of the population for the current government to stand a realistic chance of winning the next election .
mrs may might find that the only way to break the log-jam and save her premiership is to consult the country again .
accordingly , a second referendum will become an appealing option for mrs may towards the end of this year or in early 2019 . ''
the analyst who called the 2017 election exactly right says theresa may could be forced to call a second # brexit referendum
i edited a student magazine with him .
small world .
no way - which one ?
a fairly short lived one called the oxford forum .
other editors included @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
i was the editor of scan , the lancaster university student newspaper .
a loooong time ago
parl `` meaningful vote '' is between deal on offer and no-deal .

do you not think may will risk putting hard-brexit-with-some-proto-fta-deal in front of parl and blame rebels and opposition if they vote it down ( ie for no-deal ) and claim that the no-deal is n't a tory responsibility ?
the flaw in sam 's analysis is that parl only gets to choose between bad and terrible unless mps have the balls to demand art .
50 do-over .
i guess `` between bad and catastrophic '' is `` meaningful '' : (
you get one thing right , but the one you wont get right , is about another referendum .
we are not ireland , and will not be forced into another vote.if we do ( leave ) we will win by a bigger majority .
on the back of an envelope ; ref2 seems more likely than a general election .
mostly because ref2 will keep the tories in government [ . ]
# standup4ukdemocracy # standup4afirmremain # standup4ukdemocracy # standup4afirmremain

documents.title: bp boss sympathises with may
text: bp boss bob dudley said he is `` sympathetic '' towards theresa may 's brexit position .

speaking to cnbc at the egypt petroleum summit in cairo , he accused the media of putting unrealistic demands on may by expecting her to reveal the finer details of britain 's exit from the european union on a daily basis .
`` i 'm sympathetic to the prime minister for everyone wanting to know every move she 's going to make , '' he said .
`` in oil and gas you negotiate all the time constantly .
you do n't do them publicly .
and in my experience negotiators do n't come together until closer to a deadline . ''
mr dudley added that bp was `` deeply committed '' to britain .

documents.title: inflation : more reaction
text: suren thiru , head of economics at the british chambers of commerce said that inflation is likely to drift downwards .

with inflation now on a downward trajectory , this should give the bank of england enough wriggle room to keep interest rates on hold for longer than implied by the hawkish tone of their latest inflation report , particularly if economic conditions weaken as we expect .

documents.title: thomas cook try to make tunisia guests feel at ease
text: thomas cook chief executive peter fankhauser has told the today programme that his company has gone out of its way to try to make uk holidaymakers feel at ease in tunisia .
flights for uk holidaymakers to the country resumed on tuesday for the first time since the beach attack in 2015 , in which 30 britons were killed .
there is increased security at hotels and resorts and mr fankhauser said that tourists say they `` do n't feel they are in a military zone and feel they can enjoy their holidays '' .
he added : `` we are confident we have done everything we can do as a tour operator to make the holiday experience as nice as possible for our customers .
`` people who were boarding our first flight said they were excited to go back . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: thank goodness it was n't worse !
text: shares in car dealer pendragon have driven up around 15 % this morning , despite the company announcing a 20 % profits slump .

aj bell investment director russ mould explains why : `` a share price hike in response to weak 2017 results from pendragon can be attributed to investor relief that life has n't got worse for the company . ''

documents.title: mps 'need more time to understand jobs figures ' : ons
text: the office of national statistics does n't seem to have a particularly high opinion of mps ' intelligence .
it has announced that from april it 's switching round the timetable for inflation and unemployment data , so the jobs figures are not published on wednesday - the day of pmqs .
why is it doing this ?

the ons explains : `` publication of labour market statistics on the day of prime minister 's questions means there is a risk that these detailed statistics are not fully understood by parliamentarians on both sides of the house before they can be debated . ''
the ons is suggesting that mps are not capable of digesting the numbers properly in the two and a half hours available to them between publication at 09:30 and pmqs at noon .
we would n't dare comment

documents.title: may rate rise on the cards
text: howard archer , chief economic adviser to the ey item club , says today 's inflation figures increase the likelihood of a may interest rate rise :
this will highly likely reinforce the bank of england 's apparent inclination to raise interest rates again in may .
with the bank of england clearly keen to gradually normalise monetary policy , we expect may 's likely interest rate hike to 0.75 % to be followed by another increase to 1 % in november . ''

documents.title: inflation fears
text: sterling has risen following the inflation data , which showed that inflation unexpectedly held close to its highest level in nearly six years last month .
`` the big source of fright out there in the market is higher inflation .
it 's centered in the us , but it 's a global phenomenon , '' says jasper lawler at london capital group .

`` this data coming in at a slightly faster tick than we were expecting just supports that narrative that actually global inflation is on the rise and that interest rates are probably going to have to follow suit , '' he adds .

documents.title: fruit up , hair care down
text: economics correspondent andy verity has been taking a closer look at today 's inflation stats :
some of the biggest risers in the inflation numbers : fruit - up 7.2 % versus a year ago ; insurance - up 7.7 % ; electricity - up 11.4 % ; books - up 13.2 % .
getting cheaper - mineral water , hair care products and camera equipment .
real wages continue to fall , just fifty days before auto-enrolment minimum pension contributions are set to rise from 2 % to 5 % of earnings .
it 's essential to save , but money is tight for many .

documents.title: house prices climb 5.2 %
text: uk annual house prices climbed 5.2 % in december up from 5 % in november , the office of national statistics reported .
it said the annual growth rate has slowed since mid-2016 but remained broadly around 5 % in 2017 .

richardsnook , senior economist at pwc , said : today 's figures show that house price growth has outpaced average earnings growth for the fifth consecutive year , further ratcheting up the affordability challenge .
cumulatively , house prices have increased by 22 % more than earnings between 2012 and 2017 . ''

documents.title: may rate rise 'not a done deal '
text: chris williamson at ihs markit says the higher than expected inflation figure adds more pressure on the bank of england to raise interest rates again this year .
however , with mounting signs of economic growth slowing at the start of 2018 , a may rate rise is by no means a done deal and will likely be dependent on the data flow improving in coming months .
the bank of england will likely need to see indicators of the economy 's health improve to be sufficiently reassured that the economy is ready for another rise in borrowing costs . ''

documents.title: food inflation slows
text: ons senior statistician james tucker said petrol prices rose less last month than in january 2017 .
`` however , the cost of entry to attractions such as zoos and gardens fell more slowly .
after rising strongly since the middle of 2016 , food price inflation now appears to be slowing , '' he says .
`` factory goods price inflation continued to slow , with food prices falling in january .
the growth in the cost of raw materials also slowed , with the prices of some imported materials falling . ''

documents.title: sterling up
text: sterling rose 0.3 % against the dollar to $ 1.3882 as inflation holds steady at 3 % in january .
against the euro , the pound was trading flat at €1.1260 .

documents.title: breakinginflation holds steady
text: consumer price inflation remained at 3 % in january , the office for national statistics said .
economists had expected the cpi rate to fall back to 2.9 % last month .
it peaked in november at 3.1 % after reaching its highest level since march 2012 .

documents.title: can the wall street rally last ?
text: neil wilson at etx capital says european stock markets are failing to follow through on yesterday 's bounce and a decent performance overnight in asia , with the main bourses in the red this morning and the ftse 100 struggling .

`` wall street will be looking to build on a big two-day rally but there is as yet no real conviction behind this , as evidenced by the softer performance in european indices this morning , '' he says .
`` a lack of volume yesterday on wall street suggests there is not a huge amount of interest in this recovery just yet .
that suggests we are yet to build consensus around this rally and it could run into trouble if conviction is lacking . ''

documents.title: does power corrupt ?
text: earlier we asked for your comments on the views of professor kimberley scarf , who tells wake up to money it 's a problem that society `` seems to think of an aggressive and predatory individual as being charismatic and leaderly '' .
business live reader chris wharam agrees .
`` prof scharf is absolutely right .
we reward and promote social psychopaths into positions of authority and control because we believe they exhibit the qualities we admire in leadership . ''
he adds : `` people in power will nearly always be tempted to exploit their position no matter how fundamentally moral or good-natured they are .
it 's part of the human condition . ''
so does power corrupt ?
tell us what you think at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk

documents.title: nikkei sinks to four-month low
text: shares in tokyo fell back after a good start on tuesday , to end the way at a four-month low
analysts said investors were remaining cautious despite two days of gains on wall street after last week 's heavy sell-off .
the nikkei 225 lost 0.7 % , or 137 points , to finish the day at 21,244 .
elsewhere there were gains in hong kong , with the hang seng ending 1.3 % higher at 29,839 points .

documents.title: thomas cook boss on tunisia
text: `` we have taken time to make the decision to prepare our programme . ''
ceo of thomas cook group @ twitterid says they have done everything possible to prepare for british tourists to return to tunisia .
the first uk charter flight in 3 years left this morning # r4today
although i do feel sorry for honest hotel workers who lost their jobs .
not sorry enough to want to go and stay there though .
people in libya plotting as we speak
a modest programme we did everything to make the experience as nice as possible for our customers not exactly a ringing endorsement of a great trip !
same could be said of a stay in an # nhs hospital !
do we get a course in how to use an ak47 before we catch the flight .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: would you work for yourself ?
text: coming up on business live on bbc news and bbc world :
a new report says more than a quarter of young people want to run their own firm - so if you could quit work and start your own business , what would it be ?
we 'll discuss at 0830 on @ twitterid and @ twitterid # bbcbizlive .
i set-up my own company in 2008 that i do along with my normal job .

author: BBC World

documents.title: car hire firm looks to €6bn float
text: the world 's largest car hire firm , leaseplan , says it may float this year after posting a 13 % rise in profits to €677m ( £ 600m ) .
the rumoured valuation of the 50-year-old firm would be around €6bn ( £ 5.3m ) .
the company , which has a fleet of 1.7 million cars , says it is benefiting from people turning their back on car ownership , in favour of usership '' , or the sharing economy .

chief executive tex gunning said : `` increasingly , our customers - whether they are corporate , smes or private individuals - would prefer a 'car-as-a-service ' with no strings attached in terms of car type or duration .
they just want 'any car , anytime , anywhere ' . ''
it has signed a deal with uber to provide drivers with access to its fleet .

documents.title: ftse opens higher
text: the london market is 0.2 % higher at 7,191 points in the first few minutes of trading .

documents.title: charismatic , or predatory ?
text: on wake up to money earlier birmingham university economics professor kimberley scharf suggested the roots of the oxfam scandal lie in the way society rewards some human qualities .

for some reason society seems to think of an aggressive and predatory individual as being charismatic and leaderly , so individuals who exhibit these characteristics get rewarded and get put at the top of the hierarchy and it 's a problem .
it 's a problem in politics , in academia , in showbusinesses , and the charitable sector now seems to be no different . ''
do you agree with prof scharf ?
give us your thoughts at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: pendragon profits slump
text: profits at pendragon fell a fifth to £ 60.4m last year after a slowdown in uk new car sales .
the car dealer expects new car sales to 6.6 % this year - a more downbeat prediction than the society of motor manufacturers and traders - but reckons the used car market will grow by 1 % .
chief executive trevor finn said annual profits will be in line with expectations , but that the group aimed to transform the business and double revenues from used cars by 2021 .
the company 's 4.5 % rise in total revenue to £ 4.7bn was driven by a 15.3 % jump in used car sales .
in december pendragon said it would sell its us business for about £ 100m following a profit warning in october .

documents.title: ftse set to rally
text: the ftse 100 is expected to open more than 100 points higher today after a rally on wall street last night .

james bevan , chief investment officer at ccla investment management , tells today that `` most of the bad news on markets began with the us wages data and the expectation that the federal reserve would tighten rates '' .
he adds that `` the future of the us economy remains relatively parlous '' and thinks president trump needs to persuade us companies to invest in the economy .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: gucci boosts kering
text: strong sales for gucci , which has been revamped with a flamboyant new look by designer alessandro michele , has helped kering posted better-than-expected sales growth in the fourth quarter .
the luxury goods group , which also owns yves saint laurent , said revenues rose to €4.26bn in the fourth quarter , up 27.4 % compared with the same quarter in 2016 .
annual revenues were up almost as much to just under €15.5bn .
`` kering delivered a phenomenal year in 2017 , '' says chairman and chief executive francois-henri pinault .
along with rivals such as lvmh , kering benefited from a revival in demand from chinese consumers both at home and overseas last year , along with higher online sales .

documents.title: tui upbeat on summer
text: travel group tui says the summer is looking good for the business with bookings for greece , turkey and cyprus growing strongly .
it said revenues are up 8 % , while bookings are 6 % higher , and predicts that profits will climb by at least 10 % this year .
the company - which completed the rebranding of thomson in the uk to tui last autumn - narrowed its underlying core loss by more than half in the first quarter to €25.4m ( £ 22.6m ) .
it announced a new 2,894 berth cruise ship to be launched in 2023 , to follow new ships due this year and next year .

documents.title: thomas cook heads back to tunisia
text: speaking of air travel , package holidays from the uk to tunisia ended following the june 2015 beach attack in which 30 britons were killed .

after foreign office guidance to make only essential visits to the north african country was withdrawn last year , thomas cook resumed holiday sales to uk customers last august and the first flight leaves birmingham today .

interestingly , the tour operator did not stop selling trips to french , german and belgian holidaymakers after the sousse attack , as the governments of those countries did not tell their citizens to stop visiting tunisia .
holidaymakers are heading back to tunisia , more than 2 years after a terror attack on a beach there in 2015 .
@ thomascookuk is the first british tour company to resume flights to tunisia and they say things have changed :

documents.title: air fares pressure
text: investec 's victoria clarke expects inflation to hold steady at 3 % when the numbers come out at 09:30 .
however , the january figures come with new weightings for the cpi basket , which she says adds an extra layer of uncertainty .

`` we are working on the assumption that the transport services category , air fares particularly , will apply some upward pressure to the 12-month inflation rate , with the month-to-month drop in prices likely to be less than in january last year , '' ms clarke says .
there are also reports of clothing retailers scaling back promotions after christmas , when they were able to sell more stock , she adds .
that leaves more goods being sold at full prices , leading to pressure from the clothing category in january .

documents.title: inflation to fall ?
text: has inflation peaked ?
alexis gray , senior economist with vanguard , thinks so .
she tells today the big rise in inflation since the brexit vote was due to the big fall in sterling .
`` but we 're coming to the point now where that 's largely been passed through - i think inflation will moderate back to around 2 % in the next 12 to 18 months , '' ms gray says .
she also reckons may will be the month that will mark the next hike in interest rates from the bank of england .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: walgreens takeover talk
text: shares in drugs distributor amerisourcebergen jumped 20 % in after-hours us trading on reports that pharmacy giant walgreens boots alliance is in talks about making a takeover bid .
neither firm has commented on the wall street journal story .
but some analysts are suggesting that the deal would make sense for walgreens , given the potential of amazon entering the pharmacy business .
walgreens already owns about 26 % of amerisourcebergen .

documents.title: terror crackdown
text: home secretary amber rudd is in silicon valley today as the government reveals new software it says can accurately detect jihadist content online and remove it instantly .
north america technology reporter dave lee has the story :
is used more than 400 platforms to spread propaganda online last year .
that 's why uk govt has been working on a tool to help companies without the resources of facebook et al moderate their networks .
my report ( and interview with home secretary ) here :
thread : how @ twitterid explained the problem with the uk govt `` jihadi '' tool , back in 2009 -
since yesterday twitter has apparently been using an extremism blocking tool to block all tweets of links to uk blogspot addresses .

documents.title: asian markets rally
text: japan 's nikkei 225 index jumped 1 % on tuesday as traders played catch-up after monday 's public holiday .
the key market was at 21,592.5 points by late morning .
meanwhile hong kong stocks surged more than 2 % by lunch , following strong gains in europe and on wall street overnight .
the hang seng index added 2.2 % , or 642 points , to 30,102 .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to business live where we 'll be examining all the latest business news and bringing you regular market updates .
today 's big news is likely to be the latest inflation figures .
economists predict they 'll come in at 2.9 % , down from 3 % in december .
